alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 6:24PM EDT until further notice by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 623 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Palm Beach Gardens, Riviera Beach, Juno Beach, Royal Palm Beach, North Palm Beach, Lake Park, Golden Lakes, Schall Circle, The Acreage, Port Of Palm Beach, Loxahatchee Groves, Juno Ridge, Downtown West Palm Beach, Mangonia Park, Cypress Lakes, Lakeside Green, Century Village, Plantation Mobile Home Park and Fau North Campus. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
